articles.title: Artists can copyright works made with AI assistance: Agency
articles.author: Sarah Fortinsky
articles.summary: Artists can copyright their work created using AI-powered tools, according to a new report from the U.S. Copyright Office. However, work created entirely by AI would not be granted copyright protection. The report follows an extensive review of copyright law that invited input from artists, AI developers and other members of the public.

articles.title: Postman Unveils An API-First AI Agent Builder
articles.author: Janakiram MSV
articles.summary: Postman's AI Agent Builder allows developers to design, build, test and deploy intelligent agents by seamlessly integrating large language models, application programming interfaces and workflows. AI agents are changing the way we interact with technology. Postman offers a comprehensive platform that combines API development, LLM integration and workflow automation in a user-friendly environment.

articles.title: Man who refills vending machines at GA high school accused of using AI to create nude images of kids
articles.author: WSBTV.com News Staff
articles.summary: Ronald Richardson was arrested and charged with eight counts of possession of material depicting a minor in sexually explicit conduct. Ronald Richardson refills the vending machines at Gilmer High School in Georgia. A student at the school told a school resource officer that Ronald Richardson asked her to send him pictures through a social media app.

articles.title: The architecture industry may soon be unrecognizable
articles.author: William H. Dodge
articles.summary: There are radical changes headed our way and the architecture/design industry as we know it will soon cease to exist as a result. This is both exciting and terrifying at the same time. AI's rise poses as many potential benefits and challenges as it does challenges. The industry needs to change its business model and focus on the creative side of the profession.

articles.title: Press 1 for AI: machines that sound like real people taking over customer service calls
articles.author: Elizabeth Worthington
articles.summary: Anton Dahbura is co-director of Johns Hopkins Institute for Assured Autonomy. He believes AI agents will improve the customer experience in the future. Google already provides a service where an AI assistant will call a restaurant to make a reservation for you. There's a dark side to all this technology when it winds up in the wrong hands.

articles.title: DeepSeek threat boosts my belief in AI, says Meta boss Mark Zuckerberg
articles.author: The Times/The Sunday Times
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg is investing in artificial intelligence technology. Meta Platforms wants to build the AI system that people around the world are using. The threat from Chinese AI start-up DeepSeek has'strengthened' Mark Zuckerberg's conviction about investing in AI technology.

articles.title: Revolutionizing load harmony in edge computing networks with probabilistic cellular automata and Markov decision processes
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Dr. Alice Chen is an expert in the field of edge computing. Markov Decision Processes (MDPs) offer edge computing deployments unprecedented autonomy in responding to dynamic, unpredictable demands. Dr. Chen believes the next era will belong to self-managing, self-learning edge deployments that anticipate and optimize resources.

articles.title: Artificial Intelligence: Friend or Foe? A Conversation with AI Expert & Political Media President Larry Ward
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence is changing the world. Robert Chernin, Larry Ward and Ericka Redic will discuss the dangers of AI and how we can prepare for a new era of AI. Robert is a longtime successful entrepreneur, business leader, fundraiser, political advisor, and popular podcast and radio talk show host. Ericka is a Vermont and Texas-based Chief Financial Officer, author, entrepreneur, and former Republican/Libertarian Congressional candidate.

articles.title: Microsoft's Anomaly Detection in Post‑Authentication User Behavior and More North Texas Inventive Activity » Dallas Innovates
articles.author: Dallas Innovates
articles.summary: Dallas-Fort Worth ranked No. 11 for patent activity out of 250 metros for the week of Dec. 24 with a total of 133 patents granted. Newly granted patents include Microsoft's Anomaly Detection in Post‑Authentication User Behavior, 7-Eleven's item identification using multiple cameras and Verily Life Sciences' methods for using image processing to generate inferences of biomarker for immunotherapy.

articles.title: OpenAI probes DeepSeek
articles.author: Julia Shapero
articles.summary: ChatGPT maker is'reviewing indications that DeepSeek may have inappropriately distilled' its AI models. Distillation is a technique used to transfer the knowledge of a large model to a smaller one. OpenAI's terms of service bar users from using the data obtained through distillation to build competing AI products.

articles.title: Dallas- and Tel Aviv-Based Cybersecurity Platform Launches with $25M, Harnesses Agentic AI » Dallas Innovates
articles.author: Dallas Innovates
articles.summary: Conifers.ai announced $25 million in funding and the formal launch of the Conifers CognitiveSOC platform. The platform is a native AI platform that helps organizations solve security operations center challenges at scale. It is backed by SYN Ventures, Picus Capital, and others.

articles.title: State rejects application for cyber charter school with AI teacher and two hours of daily class
articles.author: Ian Karbal
articles.summary: The Pennsylvania Department of Education denied an application for a cyber charter school that uses artificial intelligence called Unbound Academy. The proposed school would have been part of a multi-state network of schools where classes are led by AI tutors and human staff serve as guides. There are currently 14 cyber charter schools operating in Pennsylvania. The schools are funded with taxpayer money.

articles.title: Gemini AI can automatically turn your spreadsheets into charts
articles.author: Wes Davis
articles.summary: Gemini has some new abilities that could make it more helpful in Sheets. Now it can respond to questions about your data with details about trends or create static charts that you can insert into your spreadsheet as images. The new capability is rolling out now to most Workspace plans and to users on the $19.99-per-month Google One AI Premium plan.

articles.title: Meta Gains After Zuckerberg Predicts ‘Really Big Year' in AI
articles.author: Riley Griffin
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg predicts a big year for Meta Platforms Inc. and its artificial intelligence assistant. Mark Zuckerberg has been using AI technology to transform how Meta's business works. Facebook and Instagram owner reported better-than-expected fourth-quarter sales of $48.4 billion. Meta plans to cut 5% of its staff in the coming weeks.

articles.title: Meta stock climbs after earnings beat on AI, smart glasses
articles.author: Britney Nguyen
articles.summary: Zuckerberg said on the company's earnings call that it plans to invest 'hundreds of billions of dollars' in artificial intelligence infrastructure in the long term. The tech giant reported revenues of $48.4 billion for the fourth quarter of 2024, 21% increase year over year, and net income of $20.8 billion. Full year revenue was $164.5 billion. The company's shares closed up 0.32%, up 15.5% so far this year.

articles.title: Report: General purpose AI could lead to array of new risks
articles.author: Marc Lutz
articles.summary: 30 countries, including the U.S. and China, back the report on the safety of advanced artificial intelligence. The International Scientific Report on the Safety of Advanced AI is being released ahead of a major AI summit in Paris next month. The report focuses on general purpose AI, typified by chatbots such as OpenAI's ChatGPT used to carry out many different kinds of tasks.

articles.title: OpenAI Hit With Wave of Mockery for Crying That Someone Stole Its Work Without Permission to Build a Competing Product
articles.author: Victor Tangermann
articles.summary: ChatGPT maker OpenAI has accused Chinese AI startup DeepSeek of stealing its intellectual property. The company claims it has "some evidence" that the startup trained its AI models on the output of OpenAI's AI models. AI critic Ed Zitron and 404 Media's Jason Koebler mock the hypocrisy of the situation.

articles.title: The DeepSeek Effect
articles.author: Math is kinda useful
articles.summary: There is a trend in the Machine Learning industry of brute force scaling. This is the easiest way to stay ahead in a field where real theoretical breakthroughs are scarce and progress is measured in benchmarks. OpenAI's ChatGPT, Anthropic's Claude, Microsoft Copilot, and a few other smaller players became what is now referred to as 'hyperscalers'. A large portion of science and scientific breakthroughs made by Chinese scientists are made by math.

articles.title: Quick Custom Intelligence and Modulus Celebrate Success at ICE
articles.author: QCI
articles.summary: Quick Custom Intelligence (QCI) and Modulus, an innovator in advanced gaming system technology, are pleased to announce a successful showcase at the International Casino Expo (ICE). Both companies met with dozens of current customers and new prospects, demonstrating the latest in AI technology and data-driven business intelligence tools. QCI's AGI platform manages more than $35 billion in annual gross gaming revenue.

articles.title: Quick Custom Intelligence and Modulus Celebrate Success at ICE
articles.author: Qci
articles.summary: Quick Custom Intelligence and Modulus are pleased to announce a successful showcase at the International Casino Expo in San Diego. The live demos highlighted how next-generation AI technology can empower casinos to make data-driven decisions, enhance customer engagement, and streamline operations.

articles.title: LinkedIn Ranks the 10 Fastest‑Growing Jobs in Dallas‑Fort Worth
articles.author: Dallas Innovates
articles.summary: LinkedIn News' 2025 list of Jobs on the Rise in Dallas-Fort Worth lists the 10 fastest-growing jobs over the past three years in the Dallas-Forth Worth metroplex. Artificial Intelligence Engineer tops the list, followed by Travel Advisor, Community Sales Manager, Electro Mechanical Technician, Property Administrator, Mental Health Therapist and Internal Audit Manager.

articles.title: Nvidia Praises DeepSeek's Breakthrough Despite Losing $500B in Market Cap Because of It
articles.author: Victor Dey
articles.summary: DeepSeek's R1 A.I. model cost $6 million to build. Microsoft and OpenAI are investigating whether DeepSeek stole OpenAI's proprietary data through GPT APIs to build R1's architecture. Itamar Friedman, the former director of machine vision at Alibaba, believes the low training cost is just the final step of the training process.

articles.title: Agentic AI needs orchestration: How ServiceNow's AI orchestrator automates complex enterprise workflows
articles.summary: ServiceNow is announcing its new AI Agent Orchestrator and AI Agent Studio. ServiceNow is in the business of enterprise workflows solutions. The AI agent orchestrator is the 'brain' that coordinates and manages the interactions between different AI agents to accomplish complex tasks. The company plans to release thousands of specialized AI agents designed to handle complex workflows.

articles.title: DeepSeek is bad for Silicon Valley. But it might be great for you.
articles.summary: DeepSeek, a Chinese startup, has launched an AI chatbot called R1. R1 is free to use but expensive to develop. The company's success is due to its unconventional, almost-open-source approach to AI development. It will make it cheaper and easier to build AI into stuff.

articles.title: Humanoid robot Galbot taking over nanny jobs and household chores – you'll never do laundry or pour your own drink again
articles.author: Forrest McFarland
articles.summary: Galbot G1 can hang clothes, pour drinks, and pick up trash. It was showcased this month at the Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas, Nevada. The battery-powered robots can run for 10 hours before they need a recharge. The G1 is 5 feet 8 inches tall and weighs 187 pounds. The robot's creators plan to deploy Galbots to markets with high labor costs over the next few years. Romi is a conversational robot developed by Mixi Inc. and costs $570.

articles.title: Authors Guild sets up 'Human Author' portal to certify books come from 'human intellect'
articles.author: Hillel Italie
articles.summary: The Authors Guild has set up an online portal for members to certify that their work is human. The guild plans to register the 'Human Authored' logo with the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office and eventually open the system to nonmembers.

articles.title: How a Free Software Strategy Catapulted DeepSeek to AI Stardom
articles.author: Belle Lin
articles.summary: DeepSeek set Silicon Valley ablaze with its new AI model. It did it in part by giving its technology away free. The open-source approach has long been used as a tactic by upstarts to upset the established dominance of larger, closed-source competitors.

articles.title: Fake evidence, new expectations and morality: Judges talk about AI in the law
articles.author: Michael Karlik
articles.summary: Judge Lino S. Lipinsky de Orlov and Colorado Supreme Court Justice Maria E. Berkenkotter spoke at the Alfred A. Arraj U.S. Courthouse in Denver about their work to identify opportunities and pitfalls for artificial intelligence in the legal profession. A state Supreme Court subcommittee has formed to address potential changes to the rules of professional conduct that would accommodate the use of emerging AI tools.

articles.title: Microsoft reports 10% quarterly profit growth as it works to show AI investments paying off
articles.author: Charles Rex Arbogast
articles.summary: Microsoft Corp.'s October-December quarter profit grew 10% from the same time last year. Overall profits and revenue beat Wall Street expectations, but it slightly missed projections for its cloud computing business, which is a centerpiece of Microsoft's AI efforts. It has spent a lot of money on AI technology.

articles.title: Meta beats earnings as it prepares to spend tens of billions on AI
articles.author: Britney Nguyen
articles.summary: Meta surpassed Wall Street's expectations with fourth-quarter results driven by artificial intelligence, smart glasses, and social media. The tech giant reported revenues of $48.4 billion for the fourth quarter of 2024. Full-year revenue was $164.5 billion. Mark Zuckerberg is planning to invest between $60 billion and $65 billion in capital expenditures on AI this year.

articles.title: Why building big AIs costs billions, and how Chinese startup DeepSeek dramatically changed the calculus
articles.author: Ambuj Tewari
articles.summary: DeepSeek, an AI startup from China, has upset expectations about how much money is needed to build the latest and greatest AIs. Their V-series models used a series of optimizations to make training cutting edge AI models significantly more economical. It took them less than $6 million to train V3.

articles.title: Texas under consideration for more Stargate projects, prompting hopes of AI rush
articles.author: James Osborne
articles.summary: For months Texas developers have been building a data center complex north of Abilene. Last week President Trump announced that tech giants Open AI and Oracle, along with the Japanese investment firm Soft Bank, were leading a consortium of technology companies to build Stargate, a $500 billion artificial intelligence network. Open AI executives flew to Austin late last week to meet with Gov. Greg Abbott and Lt. Gov. Dan Patrick. Texas officials are concerned about the data center boom.

articles.title: Microsoft profit rises but cloud business misses mark
articles.author: Glenn Chapman
articles.summary: Microsoft executives say they are on pace to spend $80 billion this fiscal year on artificial intelligence. They are innovating to help customers make money from the technology. Martin LELIEVRE is a writer at docafp.com, part of the BLOX Digital Content Exchange.

articles.title: DeepSeek Launch Should Prompt AI Security Reviews Across the Nuclear Industry
articles.author: Trey Lauderdale
articles.summary: DeepSeek R1, a new artificial intelligence (AI) model from China created a stock market meltdown on Monday, with the Nasdaq composite dropping 3% and the S&P 500 falling 1.5%. It has potential implications on many industries, including energy. Nuclear energy companies must take a more measured approach and educate their employees about the safety and security risks inherent in AI tools.

articles.title: DeepSeek is bad for Silicon Valley. But it might be great for you.
articles.author: Adam Clark Estes
articles.summary: DeepSeek-R1 is an open-source AI model that can reason on the cheap. It's free to the public and a bargain to developers who want to build apps on top of it. It is the most popular AI app in the Apple and Google app stores as of Wednesday morning. The company claims it spent less than $6 million on training R1's predecessor.

articles.title: Did DeepSeek copy ChatGPT to make new AI chatbot? Trump adviser thinks so
articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.summary: ChatGPT maker OpenAI and Trump's AI adviser suspect that the upstart Chinese tech company DeepSeek copied their AI technology to make the chatbot that shook Wall Street this week. OpenAI's official terms of use ban the technique known as distillation that enables a new AI model to learn by repeatedly querying a bigger one that's already been trained.

articles.title: Kinder Morgan, Inc. (KMI) Stock Drops 9.25% Amid DeepSeek Concerns, Analyst Views Overreaction as Market Reacts to AI Impact
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: Kinder Morgan, Inc. (NYSE:KMI) is a pipeline transportation and energy infrastructure company. Its stock plunged 9.25% from Friday's close to Tuesday's close due to news about DeepSeek. The company claims its AI models are at par or better than industry-leading models in the United States and require fewer chips and are made at a fraction of the cost.

articles.title: NOW HIRING: Jobs paying from $68K to $223K now open for historic AI project in Abilene
articles.author: Erica Garner
articles.summary: Oracle now has 9 jobs listings connected to the first phase of Project Stargate, a $500 billion plan announced by President Donald Trump to build AI infrastructure across the US. Abilene's up-and-coming Lancium Clean Energy Data Center is slated as the first location for this initiative. The job listings are looking for applicants with backgrounds in data, technology, management, and engineering fields.

articles.title: Woman feels 'offended' after boyfriend uses AI for birthday message, sparking heated debate
articles.summary: A woman on Reddit is upset because her boyfriend texted her on her 30th birthday with an AI-generated birthday wish. The post prompted a debate among thousands of people on the platform. Some people advised her to use a chatbot to send a reply to her boyfriend.

articles.title: Virtus Artificial Intelligence & Technology Opportunities Fund Discloses Sources of Distribution – Section 19(a) Notice
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: Virtus Artificial Intelligence & Technology Opportunities Fund (NYSE: AIO) announced the monthly distribution on November 20, 2024. The Fund seeks to maintain a consistent distribution level that may be paid, in part or in full, from net investment income and realized capital gains, or a combination of the two. If the Fund's aggregate net income and capital gains are less than the amount of the distribution level, a portion of the difference will be distributed from the assets.

articles.title: Microsoft reports 10% quarterly profit growth as it works to show AI investments paying off
articles.author: Associated Press Finance
articles.summary: Microsoft Corp.'s profit for the October-December quarter grew 10% from the same time last year. The Redmond, Washington-based software maker posted revenue of $69.6 billion in the quarter, up 12% from previous year. Cloud-focused business segment grew 19%, but revenue less than the $25.83 billion forecast by FactSet Research. Microsoft plans to spend $80 billion this year on AI development.

articles.title: Sugar says Trump tells people: ‘He works for me
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Lord Alan Sugar is back in charge of the new season of 'The Apprentice'. This season's contestants will be tested on their business acumen and their ability to navigate cutting-edge technologies like artificial intelligence and holograms. The first episode will air on Thursday at 9 pm on BBC One.

articles.title: Ex-Google, Apple engineers launch unconditionally open source Oumi AI platform that could help to build the next DeepSeek
articles.summary: Oumi is an all-in-one environment that streamlines the complex workflows involved in building AI models. The Oumi platform allows users to start small, using their own laptops for initial experiments and model training. Oumi also plans to develop enterprise offerings to help businesses deploy these models in production environments.

articles.title: Is This How Reddit Ends?
articles.summary: Reddit is beta-testing Reddit Answers, a chatbot with a list of tips for traveling with a baby on an airplane. It's hard to imagine any advantage to using Reddit's AI. Asking the chatbot for music recommendations will return a boring, unwieldy list.

articles.title: Skild AI reported in talks with SoftBank for $500M fundraising round
articles.author: Jake Dabkowski
articles.summary: Skild AI is in talks for a $500 million investment from Japanese investment firm SoftBank. The investment would value the company at $4 billion. Skild raised a $300 million Series A round last summer to develop artificial general intelligence software for robots to function autonomously. The company is headquartered in East Liberty and has additional office space in Silicon Valley.

articles.title: Oh Dear, Did Someone Steal Something From OpenAI?
articles.author: Joanna Stern
articles.summary: The people who create the stuff that fills the internet wrote a letter to OpenAI's CEO Sam Altman. They are concerned that Chinese startup DeepSeek may have used their product to make its product. The U.S. had an established lead in AI development and now China may have built on the backs of your success. They appreciate your efforts to strike deals and compensate those creating the works that fuel your models.

articles.title: Explainable AI techniques can improve the trustworthiness of wind power forecasts
articles.summary: Explainable artificial intelligence (XAI) is a branch of AI that helps users peek inside the black-box of AI models to understand how their output is generated and whether their forecasts can be trusted. EPFL's Wind Engineering and Renewable Energy Laboratory (WiRE) developed XAI techniques to improve wind power forecasts.

articles.title: Forge Institute to Collaborate With Air Force
articles.author: Arkansas Business Staff
articles.summary: Forge Institute of Little Rock announced a multi-year cooperative research and development agreement with the Information Directorate of the Air Force Research Laboratory. The alliance will focus on the advancement of analytic techniques for publicly available information aiming to enhance Air Force's cyber resilience and intelligence capabilities. Key collaborations will be centered around the 188th Intelligence Surveillance and Reconnaissance Group (188th ISRG) of the Arkansas Air National Guard 188th Wing.

articles.title: AI Researcher Quits; Says He's 'Pretty Terrified'
articles.author: Selwyn Duke
articles.summary: Steven Adler quit his job as an AI safety researcher in November because of the rapid development of artificial intelligence. Stephen Hawking warned that the development of full artificial intelligence could spell the end of the human race. Former Google employee Anthony Lewandowski predicts that AGI will have the entire internet at its disposal.

articles.title: Nasdaq 100: Microsoft and Meta Earnings Today—Will AI Investments Pay Off?
articles.author: FX Empire
articles.summary: Microsoft and Meta report earnings today, with AI at the heart of both companies' businesses. Microsoft and Meta are both expected to report good results.    AI is a product of Microsoft's AI research program, developed with AICore. AI is an artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Is This How Reddit Ends?
articles.author: Matteo Wong
articles.summary: Reddit has started beta-testing an AI chatbot called Reddit Answers. The chatbot is more efficient and useful than a human answer to a question, but it loses the messy, endearing quality of a good Reddit thread. The company is trying to embrace the trend of generative AI technology.

articles.title: What Is AGI? AI Experts Define It And Estimate When It's Coming To Humanity
articles.author: Ann Brown
articles.summary: Artificial general intelligence (AGI) is an advanced AI system that can perform any intellectual task a human can. It would surpass the capabilities of current AI models, such as OpenAI's ChatGPT or Google DeepMind's AlphaFold. Some experts predict AGI will be developed by 2028, while others say it's decades away.

articles.title: Scammers Create Fake News With AI To Blackmail Victims
articles.author: Lars Daniel
articles.summary: Scammers are using artificial intelligence to create fake news videos to blackmail their victims. The videos falsely accuse victims of various crimes and demand payment to prevent the dissemination of these defamatory clips. The effectiveness of these scams hinges on both advanced technology and psychological manipulation.

articles.title: Pa. officials reject cyber charter proposal to use AI software in place of teachers
articles.author: Bethany Rodgers
articles.summary: Pennsylvania officials rejected the application for a new cyber charter school that would have used artificial intelligence-based software to compress traditional academics into 2 hours per day of instruction. The state cited concerns about the unproven AI curriculum, lack of clarity on finances, and inadequate plans for special education and English language learners. Unbound Academy can appeal the decision within 30 days.

articles.title: Pa. officials reject cyber charter proposal to use AI software in place of teachers
articles.author: Bethany Rodgers
articles.summary: Unbound Academic Institute Charter School's application for a new cyber charter school has been rejected by Pennsylvania officials. The school would have used artificial intelligence-based software to compress traditional academics into 2 hours per day of instruction. Instead of teachers, the school uses educators called guides to coach students and monitor their progress.

articles.title: Bumastemra to Brussels for stricter AI rules when using music
articles.author: NOS News
articles.summary: Presenting AI-generated content as human-written is misleading and goes against ethical content creation practices. DJ Reinier Zonneveld trained his own AI model using his own music to better understand how it works. He believes it's crucial to credit artists when AI models are used to create music.

articles.title: Oak Ridge Lab's AI Marvel Slashes Cancer Diagnosis Delays:
articles.author: Source
articles.summary: Oak Ridge National Laboratory has made a breakthrough that could expedite cancer research and response times. Their efforts, backed by the Department of Energy, reduced the lag between cancer diagnosis and pathology report processing from 22 months to 14 months. This reduction is largely due to an advanced artificial intelligence technology devised by ORNL's team.

articles.title: 15 Observations About Artificial Intelligence
articles.author: Yascha Mounk
articles.summary: Sebastian is a regular contributor to Substack, a blog where he shares his thoughts in a direct, unfiltered way. He believes that AI is useful and useful technology. He uses apps like ChatGPT, Claude and DeepSeek to help people with various tasks.

articles.title: AI Bots Proposed To Replace Teachers In PA Schools
articles.author: Justin Heinze
articles.summary: Unbound Academic Institute proposed to replace human teachers with artificial intelligence in its online charter school. The application was rejected by the Pennsylvania Department of Education. A similar program from Unbound has already been approved in a public school in Arizona and connected to private schools in Texas and Florida.

articles.title: OpenAI says DeepSeek may have used its tech to train chatbot
articles.author: Susan Carpenter
articles.summary: The U.S. artificial intelligence company OpenAI is investigating whether DeepSeek developed its technology using OpenAI data and tools. The company is aware that groups in the People's Republic of China are working to use distillation to try to replicate advanced American AI models. Distillation transfers knowledge from a large language model to a smaller model.

articles.title: AI-assisted works can get copyright with enough human creativity, says US copyright office
articles.author: MATT O'BRIEN
articles.summary: Artists can copyright works they made with the help of artificial intelligence, according to a new report by the U.S. Copyright Office. It follows a review that began in 2023 and fielded opinions from thousands of people that ranged from AI developers, to actors and country singers. It shows the copyright office will continue to reject copyright claims for fully machine-generated content.

articles.title: AI-assisted works can get copyright with enough human creativity, says US copyright office
articles.author: Associated Press
articles.summary: An AI-assisted work could be copyrightable if an artist's handiwork is perceptible. A human adapting an AI-generated output with 'creative arrangements or modifications' could also make it fall under copyright protections. The current limit is that it can be copyrighted if it's a work of art.

articles.title: Goldman Sachs recruits Daniel Marcu from Amazon for AI role
articles.summary: Daniel Marcu has been hired by Goldman Sachs as head of artificial intelligence engineering and science. He was previously vice president of Web and Knowledge Services in Alexa Information and later in Amazon Artificial General Intelligence. His expertise will now be directed towards Goldman Sachs' AI initiatives.

articles.title: ‘We live in amazing times': Smartsheet leader calls AI a ‘gift' that is transforming how we live and work
articles.author: Kurt Schlosser
articles.summary: Praerit Garg is the president of product and innovation at Smartsheet, which was recently acquired by Blackstone and Vista Equity Partners. He is excited about the future of work thanks to artificial intelligence, which he describes as a 'gift' from God.

articles.title: Memo to Hegseth: It isn't about AI technology; it's about counter-AI doctrine
articles.author: Chuck De Caro
articles.summary: Secretary Hegseth is worried about China's headlong embrace of artificial intelligence. He suggests the establishment of a doctrine of AI countermeasures to blunt Chinese AI systems. He proposes polluting large language models to create negative effects, using Conway's law as guidance for exploitable flaws, using bias among adversaries' leadership to degrade their AI systems, and using advanced radio-frequency weapons to disrupt AI-supporting computer hardware.

articles.title: OpenAI accuses DeepSeek of data theft, internet calls out hypocrisy
articles.author: Kaif Shaikh
articles.summary: OpenAI is accusing Chinese AI startup DeepSeek of using its proprietary models' outputs to train a competing chatbot. OpenAI has been sued for alleged copyright infringement and data misuse on multiple occasions. The White House has stated it is currently evaluating possible risks associated with the technology.

articles.title: Alibaba launches AI model to challenge Deepseek
articles.author: Business Day Online
articles.summary: Alibaba has launched Qwen 2.5-VL, its latest visual-language Artificial Intelligence model. According to Alibaba, it outperforms DeepSeek V3 and is better than it's predecessor, DeepSeeks V3. The model is available in English and in Chinese.

articles.title: The Evolution Of Proof Of Human Uniqueness: Building Trust In AI Age
articles.author: Taarini Kaur Dang
articles.summary: As digital technology advances, the need for secure and reliable verification methods to prove humanness grows. Modern proof-of-human systems focus solely on establishing that a user is human without identifying who they are. They prioritize anonymity and inclusivity, ensuring individuals can interact freely without sacrificing their privacy.

articles.title: Apple Just Changed a Key Setting On Your iPhone. Here's Why You Should Change It Back
articles.author: Tbowe
articles.summary: iOS 18.3 has new Apple Intelligence features that use AI to tell you about the world around you. Only iPhone 16 models and the iPhone 15 Pro/Max support Apple Intelligence. If you have one of the newest iPhones and you download the latest software, Apple Intelligence eats 7GB of storage. You can turn it off in the Settings app.

articles.title: Apple Just Changed a Key Setting On Your iPhone. Here's Why You Should Change It Back
articles.author: Tucker Bowe
articles.summary: Apple rolled out iOS 18.3 this week, delivering new Apple Intelligence features to all compatible iPhones. New Visual Intelligence features use Apple's AI to tell you about the world around you. iPhone 16 and iPhone 15 Pro/Max owners have to manually turn on Apple Intelligence to access it. New default setting turns it on by default.

articles.title: Google: Hackers Tried (and Failed) to Use Gemini AI to Breach Accounts
articles.author: PC Mag
articles.summary: State-sponsored hackers from Iran, North Korea, China, and Russia have been using Google's AI chatbot Gemini for tasks such as translating content, refining phishing attacks, and computer coding. Google says the activity has not led to any groundbreaking cyber threats. The company is designing its AI systems with robust security measures to stop abuse.

articles.title: Softbank to invest $500 million in robotics startup SkildAI
articles.author: ABcontributor
articles.summary: Softbank is negotiating a $500 million investment in Skild AI, a software company building a financial model at a $4 billion valuation. There has been significant investor interest in the intersection of AI and robotics in recent times. Jeff Bezos has increased his funding for AI-based robotics startups.

articles.title: AI model learns generalized 'language' of regulatory genomics, predicts cellular stories
articles.author: Science X staff
articles.summary: A team of investigators from Dana-Farber Cancer Institute, The Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard, Google, and Columbia University have created an artificial intelligence model that can predict which genes are expressed in any type of human cell. The model, called EpiBERT, was inspired by BERT, a deep learning model designed to understand and generate human-like language.

articles.title: OpenAI investigating whether DeepSeek improperly obtained data
articles.author: The Hill
articles.summary: OpenAI is investigating whether Chinese AI startup DeepSeek improperly obtained data from its models to build a popular new AI assistant. The ChatGPT maker said it is'reviewing' indications that the startup may have inappropriately distilled data from the data it collected.

articles.title: Why building big AIs costs billions - and how Chinese startup DeepSeek dramatically changed the calculus
articles.author: Beijing News
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence systems like OpenAI's ChatGPT, Google's Gemini and Anthropic's Claude produce fluent text in multiple languages in response to user prompts. The technology has captured the public's imagination and has become a hot topic in the last few years.

articles.title: Meta considers testing DeepSeek in generative AI tools meant for advertisers
articles.summary: Some advertisers complained to Meta about the accuracy of the text- and image-generation tools powered by the company's in-house LLM, Llama.
